meanings.sent1: She always makes sure to prealter the recipe before cooking.
meanings.sent2: The students are prealtering their presentations to avoid last-minute changes.
meanings.sent3: The chef prealtered the ingredients, so the dish turned out perfectly.
meanings.sent4: By prealtering his schedule, he managed to finish all his tasks ahead of time.
meanings.sent5: Prealtering the settings on the camera helped capture the perfect shot.

meanings.definition: The act of altering before something else.
meanings.sent1: The prealtering of the contract saved them from future disputes.
meanings.sent2: His prealtering of the document ensured its accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The prealtering of the play's script added an unexpected twist to the story.
meanings.sent4: The prealtering of the painting gave it a unique touch.
meanings.sent5: Her prealtering of the outfit made it stand out at the event.
